data.title: Larissa Rodrigues Pinho Lawyer / Attorney
meta_keywords: practices in Technology and Life Sciences groups
data.meta_description: Goodwin Associate Larissa Rodrigues Pinho, from New York, practices in Technology and Life Sciences groups
data.text:
Larissa Rodrigues Pinho is an associate in Goodwin’s Life Sciences group. Larissa represents private and public clients in a broad range of transactions throughout the corporate lifecycle. Larissa has significant expertise in acquisition and investment contracts in domestic and cross-border life sciences M&A transactions. Her experience also includes venture capital financings, capital market transactions, among other strategic and complex transactions, such as collaborations and licensing arrangements. She also counsels clients on a wide array of corporate matters, such as startup formation, securities law compliance and corporate governance. Larissa joined Goodwin in 2021.

Prior to joining Goodwin, Larissa was a legal intern at Jones Day in New York and an associate at Demarest and Tauil & Chequer Advogados in association with Mayer Brown in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

While attending law school in Brazil, Larissa was the Teaching Assistant to Corporate and Securities Law course. At Northwestern University, she was the LL.M. Representative of the Students’ Executive Board of the Donald Pritzker Entrepreneurship Law Center. Larissa was also a member of the duo nominated National Champion representing Northwestern University in the LawMeets® 2020 M&A Boot Camp, organized in association with the ABA Business Law Section’s M&A Committee.

She is active in pro bono projects and, prior to joining Goodwin, led research teams in two pro bono projects related to women’s rights and forced marriage in Trinidad and Tobago and LGBTQ+ rights in Brazil, both selected as global pro bono projects of the year. At Northwestern University, Larissa volunteered with the Illinois Legal Aid Help. At Goodwin, Larissa volunteered with Legal Services NYC assisting people in NY to apply for COVID-19 emergency rental assistance, Transgender Law Center (TLC) in creating a state-by-state guide on how to undertake the legal name change process while incarcerated, National Women’s Law Center (NWLC) in drafting a memo analyzing all US states abortion bans and their implication on birth control, Asian American Legal Defense and Education Fund (AALDEF) in poll monitoring the US 2022 mid-term elections in New York City, among others.
